Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Early voting in Louisiana starts TODAY, and this year we have a historic opportunity to advance justice by voting YES on Amendment 2 and for candidates who support smart justice reforms.

We've made it easy to vote for justice and fairness by creating VoteSmartJustice.org, a new tool with all the information you need to fight mass incarceration this fall.

Visit Louisiana's page on VoteSmartJustice.org to get voting info, see candidates' records on criminal justice issues, and learn more about what's on the ballot, including Constitutional Amendment 2 to restore the right to unanimous juries.

Louisiana is the only state in the country where someone can be sentenced to life even if two members of the jury believe they're innocent.

Non-unanimous juries lead to more wrongful convictions, exacerbate racial disparities, and violate the fundamental principle of innocence until proven guilty beyond a reasonable doubt.

We can stop this injustice, but only if we get out and vote YES on Amendment 2. Check out VoteSmartJustice.org to learn more and get ready to vote like your rights depend on it.

Thanks for making your voice heard,

ACLU of Louisiana
